column2: The time has come to shatter the taboo of slavery! Lead the way, and other Remnants of the Fifth Nation will follow!
Slavery will be reinstated, allowing the legalization of Slavery among pirate governments.

Under the Marquess of the Eastern Sea, the Fifth Nation was more than a few banded raiders -- it was organized, and it had true strength. If we are determined to restore our former glory, we must first rebuild the structure that led to that glory in the first place.
Can peacefully annex any Pirate Governor tributaries you control and turn them into vassals.
'Plunder' casus belli will create vassals instead of tributaries.
With the Black Market established, 'Plunder' casus belli will convert conquered territories to 5th Nation Remnant Culture.
With Slavery legalized, can use 'Establish Slave Colony' casus belli, to create a one-county tributary with very high tribute payments.
Establishing an underground market for moving illicit goods would make plundering more profitable and pave the way for a slave-economy.
The Black Market Society is established.
'Plunder' casus belli will reward more gold.
Creates a permanent fleet of no-maintenance ships, with the size of the fleet scaling with the influence of the Black Market.
Any Pirate Governor under your control can be forced to legalize Slavery, so long as you have legalized it yourself.
[Root.GetFirstName] will adopt the Legal Slavery law.
Sells a prisoner you have into slavery for gold. High-quality slaves will increase Society Influence and Moral Authority, as well as reward you with some society power.
Settle the people of the Fifth Nation into the county, to solidify our influence there.
Not so much a government as a lack thereof, Lawless Piracy represents a society of thugs and hooligans who spend their days plundering the coastline.
Although disorganized and lawless, there is a tipping point for piracy when it becomes simply too big to not have any real leadership. This is when cartels begin to form
column3: powerful families, brutal in their operations, but effective at governing. Through a campaign of terror and intimidation, these cartels are able to unite the once city-state Pirate Governors into a cohesive nation.

column2: The Fifth Nation kept slaves to ensure its own people would always be free from the burdens of the world.
Legalizing slavery is one of the first steps to restoring the Fifth Nation.
You may force any Pirate Governors under your control to Adopt Slavery. If they do, their capital holding will be converted to Tagaka's Legacy.
An underground network of buyers and sellers who deal in illicit goods and slaves.
Sells a prisoner you have into slavery for gold. Increases Society Influence and Moral Authority if the slave is of high-quality.

column1: High-quality slaves include characters with high titles, powerful benders, young lusty women, young strong men, and eunuchs.

column2: Once-in-a-life decision to create a permanent, no maintenance fleet of ships. The number of ships you get increases if Society Influence is higher.
Have a chunk of your crew settle down in a county permanently, to make it a true pirate-town. Change the culture of a county to Fifth Nation Remnants, and increase Moral Authority.
Storm the gates and pillage the city! Once we've ransacked all the valuables, we'll establish a new governor loyal to us!
This county will be added to your territory, and automatically assgined a vassal under your control.
This county will be added to your territory, and automatically assgined a vassal under your control. The culture will change to [Root.Culture.GetName].
With heightened organization and slavery legalized, we can go beyond plundering and enslave entire regions!

You give a sickly smile, watching dark clouds bellow from the forge into the sky. Every smith in the city is hard at work, but there's no armor to be made, nor weapons. Instead, you watch as the hammer comes down on a fresh pair of manacles, still red from the furnace. Just a few now, but soon, as many pairs as you need. Overcome with a horrendous glee, you feel as though you're bearing witness to the start of something much larger than yourself.
The Earth Kingdom has so many people... why not share them?

Dark rumors have found their way to your court, as word has reached you that slavery is making a resurgence in the Eastern Sea. Once exterminated - first by Avatar Kyoshi's resounding victory over the Fifth Nation, second by a cooperative effort among the Four Nations to liberate the remaining slave holdouts - no sign of the practice has been witnessed in decades. If left unchecked, this market could swell in power, and lead to a complete rebirth of the outlaw-nation.
This barbaric practice must be abolished!

You'd never think anything was out of the ordinary, wandering the market. Bustling crowds, merchants screaming over one another pushing their wares, the humdrum sounds of life in all directions. But you know the signs. A trader blinking a strange pattern. A quick hand gesture there, followed by a tap on the nose. Suddenly, a homeless man approaches you and horsely belts out "got any coin of the Four nations?". You quietly say back "No, but I have of the Fifth". Cracking a gummy smile, the destitute man whispers "Please, my Lord, follow me".
We've got a lot of work ahead of us...

Striding out onto the dock with a setting sun behind you, you take stock of a handful of battle-worn ships. They're not the most impressive you've seen, but considering the strings you had to pull to get them, they could be much worse. Following behind you, the shipwright responsible for their acquisition fidgets with antipication, as if preparing to be scolded. "Where did they come from?", you ask. "Wherever we could find them, my Lord. Some off the coast of the Southern tribes. Most fell apart on the way back." You grumble, but considering the kind of fleet you're building, this isn't an unusual start. "Fine. Let's get to work repairing them. By the month's end, I want to set these down the coastline to attack the southern isles".
Let's not waste any time. To adventure, and plunder!

Beaming with pride, your shipwright gestures you towards a nearby pier and bellows "this way to your fleet, my Lord". You knew the Black Market would provide, but never in your wildest dreams did you expect this. What's waiting for you at the dock isn't just a fleet -- it's a Navy. The sort fit for Kings, and Emperors. The kind that used to transport armies, not just sail a bunch of plundering hooligans port-to-port. You gawk, as your mind runs wild with thinking how you would even put such a fleet to use. Gradually, your fixation on the ships wanes, and you finally manage to speak. "Are... all of these mine?". With what teeth he has left, the shipwright smiles, and says "Of course they are, Captain".
Wind at your back lads, wherever you go! You are a pirate!
Hang the black flag at the end of the mast!
Mostly remnants from 5th Nation after its fall to Kyoshi, pirates are raiders and thugs that sail port-to-port plundering the coastline.
